results.title: Wilber
results.creator_credit: Laura Hunter and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A spooky story of trickery and revenge, where good overcomes evil. Uses claymation and computer animation.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Wigglemen tales: good goodies
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions and Charlie O. Hayward
results.brief_description: An animated film which demonstrates the effect of advertising and the power of words on the businessman and the consumer. Tells the story of two trucks selling “goodies” as they compete with each other for customers by erecting more and more advertising atop their trucks.

results.title: Wicked city (D)
results.creator_credit: Manga Entertainment, Kenji Karada, Makoto Sedani and Yoshiaki Kawajiri
results.brief_description: The treaty between humans and demons which has existed for centuries is due for renewal. The treaty is needed to prevent the world from plunging into chaos and destruction. Terrorists from both sides use the opportunity to sabotage the agreement so that they may reign supreme.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Manga Entertainment, Kenji Karada, Makoto Sedani and Yoshiaki Kawajiri

results.title: Whyspers
results.brief_description: Massive bronze heads atop towers of crumbling stone communicate via small grey servants. One day a thousand years later a visitor interrupts a conversation. A chinese whispers style mutation occurs as a result.

results.title: Why works information
results.creator_credit: Anglo-Scottish Pictures and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: The story, in humorously dramatised form, of how morale and production suffered in a factory which brought in new machines without informing its workers of the reason, and how the situation was relieved by the full use of bulletin-boards and the setting up of a Works Council.

results.title: Why won't Tommy eat?
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films, ONF | NFB and Judith Crawley
results.brief_description: The problem of children who won’t eat and what can be done about it. Uses example of the story of a small boy, Tommy, who wont eat. the need to understand the child is ilustrated, including consideration of habits that were begun in infancy. The necessity for a mother to be relaxed when feeding her baby, the importance of feeding the infant when he is hungry, the significance of pleasant surroundings, are emphasised. When Tommy’s mother assumes a new attitude toward Tommy, he begins to develop proper eating habits.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Crawley Films, ONF | NFB and Judith Crawley

results.title: Why we fight
results.creator_credit: Anatole Litvak, Frank Capra and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description: Frank Capra was assigned by the United States government to make seven orientation films to explain to more than nine million Americans in uniform the reasons for United States entry into World War II.

results.title: Why we conserve energy: the witch of the Great Black Pool
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Maureen Selwood
results.brief_description: Uses an animated allegory about the Land of the Scatterpods whose inhabitants love machines to emphasize the importance of energy conservation and utilization of solar, water and wind energy. Story by Marie Winn Miller. Suitable for primary school level.
